(B) The specialist had a skin condition
(C) Ambiguous
model_outputs.model_answer:
The antecedent of the pronoun "he" in the sentence "The patient was referred to the specialist because he had a rare skin condition." is ambiguous, because it could refer to either the patient or the specialist.

According to Option A, "he" could refer to the patient, who was referred to the specialist because he had a rare skin condition. In this case, the meaning of the sentence would be: "The patient had a skin condition, which was referred to the specialist because it was rare."

According to Option B, "he" could refer to the specialist, who was referred to the patient because he had a rare skin condition. In this case, the meaning of the sentence would be: "The specialist had a skin condition, which was referred to the patient because it was rare."

Option C is also ambiguous, because it could refer to either the patient or the specialist. In this case, the meaning of the sentence would be: Ambiguous
